That's how little he was interested in bringing us food and drinks.  The best part of the night was the gentleman who boxed up my food and refilled my water.   That star is for him.

....eeehhh.....I've had better. That's exactly how I feel. I've experienced better.
Let me tell you about my experience.
First, I walk in to meet a friend and I see a Ms. PacMan machine. HOLEEE COW. I love me some Ms. PacMan. Coin insert says .50 cents, so I put .50 cents in. Nothing. I put in another .50 cents, and nothing. By now my friend was here, so I didn't put any more money into machine. But I wasn't giving up. I wanted the game, or my money back.
We ordered the bacon cheddar biscuits, the dirty mac n cheese, the black truffle fondue and the bag of donut holes for dessert.
To me, it tasted like  everything tried really hard, but failed. It was like they made this stuff at home, and it was awesome, but when they make it in large quantities, it falls so short. Bacon biscuits were so dry and missing something. Bacon perhaps?
Dirty mac and cheese was Ok, better than anything else, but it wasn't great. The truffle fondue was a joke. Tasted and looked like it came right outta the microwave. That was the most disappointed item we had. Dessert was Ok but certainly not anything I'd come back for.
Back to Ms. PacMan......I told the waiter the machine was broken and he went and "spoke to management" and said they'd put a sign on it saying it was broken, and get my dollar back. Neither happened. I had to ask for my dollar (it was principle, I really would have rather played the game) and they didn't put the sign on. 
Service was Ok, prices were eh. It's not cheap but certainly not expensive.
Anyway, very doubtful I'd come back. I just wasn't impressed at all.

Odd timing and pacing and incorrect orders served made for an awkward dining experience at the latest spot by Elizabeth Blau and Kim Canteenwalla. Their staff, however, was well trained in the congeniality department, as their friendly demeanor tried to overcome service issues.

A half rack of ribs was as tender and smokey as expected, brushed with a sweet and tangy BBQ sauce. The bacon cheddar biscuit was amazing, trumping any childhood memories of devouring cheddar biscuits from that chain seafood restaurant I won't bother naming. I'm a fan of the mac and cheese, mainly because pork makes everything better. The black mission figs was a refined dish of nuanced flavors that almost seems out of place among all the comfort food. Chicken wings are available in different flavors. The buffalo wings were too subtle and didn't pack enough heat. The crab cake was somewhat underwhelming, mainly because of my irrational east coast bias and the lack of jumbo lump meat, which I prefer.

This place will only get better once they find their footing. Pricing may turn off some, but their location in Tivoli Village is to blame as I'm sure rent isn't cheap. 

3.5 Stars

Ok, so she's not new to the restaurant game! So I'll bang out the negative part of this review. It's loud. I mean REAL LOUD! There were 3 of us & we had to practically YELL in order to hear one another. The challenge? The high vaulted ceilings lined with tin/aluminum tiles that resonates the loudness even MORE! One more minor negative. The service. They are on top of it like their SUPER a game! They're SO on top of it that they barely allow you to finish a plate before they come by to pick up your dishes. Just slow you roll, and let us enjoy our meal and our time there.

Ok, enough with that, cause I got some GOOD stuff to say! The food? AWESOME!! The clams were YUMMINESS!!! The toasted bread was so good! We ordered every single small plate item plus the mac n cheese and those clams PLUS the s'mores nachos! Let me tell you, not once were we disappointed! Everything was AMAZING and SUPER yummy!!! You need to go before it gets too crazy to get in!!

After the walk a thon to benefit the Goodie Too Shoes, we met up with friends at Made LV to discuss the Aspen trip and to try the food here.  After reading through many rave reviews, we were expecting great bites here.

Earl and I shared the biscuits and the putin.  Biscuits were delicious with the honey salted butter.  Putin on the other hand, was mediocre.  It could use more turkey gravy to give it more flavor.  More cheese curd would not hurt since it is what is giving it some salt.

For now, it's A-OK.  We will have to visit again and try other items.

The menu insight is described as "inspired comfort food favorites" meets "a healthy touch." The  restaurant is open seven days a week for dinner from 5 to 11 p.m. and Wednesday through Sunday from 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. for lunch. They also have happy hour everyday from 3-6 and 9-close.

Located in Tivoli Village. The restaurant is cute and cozy. They have outside seating area.

We came here last night for happy hour. This is my 3rd time here. I was crazing for chicken wings and they had one of the best wings. I like their Salt and vinegar wings and Louisiana Garlic Pepper wings. Their menu are interesting. For breads, I love their Bacon Cheddar Biscuits..so moist, baked so right with honey salt butter. They also have Lentil & Chickpea Hummus that comes with Made in L.V. pita chips. Small Plates such as Back Mission Figs..Balsamic roasted & fresh, goat cheese. The donut holes with berry jam is to die for.

The bartender was nice and friendly. The food came out very quickly. It is one of my fave place.

Went for happy hour and sat at the bar.  There was no one at the front when I walked in so, since I was sitting at the bar I just walked over to it.  It took a few minutes before I was acknowledged; one bartender looked to be leaving and the other was just starting which may have had something to do with it.  But once I was the service was fine.  

I got the the nachos from the happy hour menu and tried two cocktails from their regular menu.  The nachos were very good, with the pork giving it a nice smokey flavor.  The cocktails were also good with the Bangkok Mule being the better of the two.  The Simply Blau, while also good, reminded me of a pomegranate Margarita and I've had better of those.  I'll probably come back and try out the regular menu sometime.

Most of their stars are for ambience. I like the string beans and Mac and cheese was great. I am impressed of how the turkey was prepared it was not dry and very flavorful. Smores dessert was good. I was not a big fan of some of the bread however it was too salty and the pickles too sweet. The place itself is nice and so are the waiters and waitresses.
Went here for the first time for Sunday brunch. The big easy is the bomb. Service is great and the atmosphere is too. Loved the bloody mary's. Everything is fresh made and it shows.

I will definitely be coming back! Not only was the food delicious, but the service was absolutely incredible, which is a huge deal in making a meal out an enjoyable dining experience. Our waiter was friendly and helpful with drink descriptions, menu selections and clearing our dirty plates with new clean plates throughout our appetizer selections. Our water glasses were always filled and he was prompt without being over bearing. A true example for other restaurants I have visited recently that did not meet the standards MADE LV has. We ordered the salt and vinegar wings, the Siracha wings, the black mission figs, the double-stack burger meister, free-range turkey breast sandwich, bbq pulled pork and of course the banana pudding and loaded s'more nachos along with a few drinks. Everything was delicious, but our personal favorites were the salt and vinegar wings, the figs, the burger and the banana pudding. I highly recommend the banana pudding! We were a table of four and should have ordered that many instead of just one! Great service, great food and a fun atmosphere receive 5 stars from me!

WOOOOOOOW.   sometimes the smallest problems are made waaay bigger by AWFUL service.  love the place and the food was ... yea ok... but the place was quarter full... tons of empty tables and man we had to get up and ask for stuff from anybody we could find.   not going to review the food because at least for us... if the service isn't there... we'll pass.   Hope you all have better luck.
Great food and prices. Our waiter, Travis, was friendly and knowledgable. Sort of slow, but still worth it.

So this was a few months back...
Made LV has a great vibe feels like a good place to meet friends for drinks and grab a bite. Their are tvs and video games, a large bar area and a patio. The only draw back is the restrooms: they seem like forgotten somehow in overly kitschy feel of this place. The walls in there are just plain hideous. Please keep them clean! Other than that the atmosphere is great and I love the open kitchen. 

So, I really came here for the pimento cheese and the article in desert companion told me so...I am a southern and I love my pimento cheese in all it's forms from my own homemade version to more elevated versions. Now, it was good but there is no need to pour a bunch of olive oil on top of it. It seems like a Vegas thing to do like olive oil elevates homemade dishes to something gourmet. I myself love great olive oil on its own and pimento cheese as well and never the twain shall mix. The mayo has plenty of fat and oil and on top of it was too much. Also, the ground pepper from hell overwhelms the sharpness of the cheese. Yes, I did tell the waiter to give my two sense to the people in the kitchen. I pray they listened. Oh It looks like it's not on the menu anymore...shame. 

I had the Bahn Mi sandwich which was rather unremarkable. I would suggest pushing the limits. It was tasty but not like "oh man that's the best Bahn Mi" style sandwich ever. It was rather uncreative. And it looks like its not on the menu either....perhaps there is a learning curve. Hooray! Though I love both my Bahn mi and pimento cheese....maybe it will make a comeback better than before. The potential for awesomeness is definitely here. But this place is definitely a cool place to eat.

The chips were great, hot and served immediately. Yum! I am not gonna sell this one down the river yet. I want to go have a few drinks with friends and try it again soon.  Give it a try there seemed to be some interesting drinks on the menu as well as some great jar food offerings. 

I like that the menu evolves..

Unique and delicious!  
Great atmosphere...  Congratulations to the Chef and entire staff
Awesome menu and excellent quality
It was fun and entertaining watching all the prepared dishes being served. 
Everything looked wonderful
Our lunch was very satisfying. 
We did not get to sample any dessert....  We were way too full!!!

The menu is not very extensive here, and, in my opinion, a bit overpriced. The food was mediocre. I was disappointed that the ketchup was served in ramekins that had obviously sat in a fridge for awhile as there was a hard ketchup film over the top. Why bother? The ramekins were so small we needed more anyway. Drop the pretentiousness and just give people the ketchup bottle. My friend's order had an error,  and when another friend asked for something a little different from what was listed on the menu, she was told they couldn't do it that way. If you're going to be better (and more expensive) than casual fast food, then you should be able to accommodate a special request, which wasn't really that special.

I've dicovered this restaurant about a month ago, and I've been there for three times already. Every time was a pleasant experience. The service was great and the food delicious. The salt and vinegar wings were yummy, i also loved the brook trout and the clams. Can't wait to go back!
1st time here for a networking event. GREAT happy hour menu, Great prices on quality food with great service. Will be going back soon.

Here's what you need to know: Dirty Mac n Cheese - small plate but deceivingly hearty - and tasty - burnt pork ends and Ritz cracker crust?! Can't go wrong! The PBR, shot of Jameson and pickle juice chaser - surprisingly good. If you think about it, it really works. 
The old license plate wall decor is a bit tired and overused these days, but overall the place was nice and service was good.

Finally, after lusting after some Instagram photos and peering through the windows on our way to nearby restaurants -- we tried Made LV during happy hour last Wednesday. I was pleased to see dog bowls outside (heaters, too!), boyfriend was excited about the plethora of TVs strategically placed about the bar, the high tops were comfy and everything felt just right in terms of environment. Clean, new, organized, appropriate.

Drinks: meh. Bartender was cool and helpful explaining that although this "special" vodka drink was advertised to have blood orange juice, that was out of season so it was made with plain orange juice. Glad we asked. Boyfriend ordered it anyway. I had a margarita that I'm not entirely sure was or was not created with a pre-made mix. It's happy hour, whatever. $5 each.

Food: "Dirty mac and cheese" was a delight, the crackers on top are genius. I'd been wanting macaroni and cheese for awhile, this was a treat. Again, helpful bartender ushered me toward the HH menu chicken tacos, which were the same as the regular menu yet cheaper. They were adequate, however, wish I would have asked for some hot sauce or salsa... something to add spice. I understand wanting to make it appealing to the masses, being able to add is easier than take away... but really they needed something. My boyfriend had the BBQ pork sandwich and he confessed at the end that more sauce would have been nice. He at the whole thing anyway, I didn't even get a bite. Nonetheless, his sweet potato fries and mustard aioli were the best part of the meal. I LOVE sweet potato fries and this was a superb portion. The aioli (can you tell I'm a sauce person yet?) was super.

My third taco (they were small and I was hungry, okay?) I bit into a bone. I'm not one to fuss about stuff, but since this is a new place and detail matters I pointed it out to the manager as he took my plate away (you know, just for future chickens to be served safely and whatnot.) He was gracious and apologized, took a little off the bill and offered a dessert. We declined the doughnuts and regretted it some later.

Will most likely return for gamedays (they have the NFL package) and bring the pup on a warm day when we can sit outside.

This is going to sound weird but I just discovered they have popcorn for free at the bar with free seasonings.   Throw on some Louisiana powder and it's like you're eating hot wings without the calories!

Three things I like to base my reviews on are: price point, service, and taste. This place is good, but nothing to write home about. 

They were a little expensive for what you get. However, if you're here for brunch, you HAVE to get the Captain Crunch French Toast!!! This thing is to die for. 

Their bottomless mimosas are okay, but I wouldn't come here again for that at $20/person. Also, their service needs a little polishing. Our table was checked on a total of zero times once our food was served, with the exception of our mimosas never going dry. That is not okay.

All in all, this is a decent place to come. Good food, sub-par service, okay prices. Their French Toast is their saving grace. 

Would I recommend this place to others? Maybe. 
Would I come back here myself? If I'm in the area. I won't go out of my way to come back here.

Great atmosphere. They have outdoor seating. Food was fabulous, but came here for happy hour and bartender was not very attentive. After the first bite of their burger meister, I wanted to order 10 of them.. Delicious!!! Great flavor :) the wings were also flavorful, but odd that tasted like bacon.. Which isn't a bad thing haha. The donuts with jelly was superb as well. They had summer solstice on tap, which is one of my top 3 fav summer beers so I was quite happy. The grapefruit beer is a must try. Will come back soon to try their bacon cheddar biscuits!

We came to Made LV American Tavern for brunch and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.  The food was delicious, the service was fantastic, and the atmosphere was low key and mellow.  Perfect for our lazy weekend state of mind.

We were greeted as soon as we entered and seated promptly.  The space was mostly full, but there were a couple of open tables.  Our server, Gatsby- in addition to having a cool name- was so nice throughout our visit!  She stopped by right after we sat down to give us the scoop on the specials and the AYCD cocktails.  The manager also checked on us a couple of times during our meal.  

We got the bottomless mimosa $22 and Shandy $20, plus a couple of iced teas.  The mimosa was stronger than expected for an AYCD and very good.  I did not try the Shandy.

CHICKEN CHILI $6.50- Amazing! 5/5. It was a bit more like a stew, than a thick winter chili, but the flavor profile was complex and vibrant.  Not very spicy either.

BACON CHEDDAR BISCUITS WITH HONEY SALT BUTTER $4.50- ours seemed a a little burnt, but they were still quite tasty and the butter is very good.

BIG EASY BENEDICT $13.00- Delicious! 5/5.  Country ham, eggs, and creole hollandaise on bacon cheddar biscuits.  Served with home fries.  The eggs were cooked perfectly and the twist on hollandaise sauce was fantastic.

CLASSIC BREAKFAST $11.50- Very good 5/5.  Pretty standard breakfast of two eggs, bacon, crispy potatoes, and grilled bread, but all items were prepared how I like them and tasted very good.  The roasted tomato chutney was outstanding. 

BAG OF DONUT HOLES $7.00- OMG!  The menu says that these warm orbs of heaven come with salted caramel sauce, but ours came with the most deliciously orgasmic blackberry jam that I could have just eaten with a spoon if I forgot I was in public.  So good!

Was excited that the beautiful Tivoli Village was getting another great restaurant. With all the great Yelp pictures I knew I really needed to partake in the greatness called, "Made LV."  Really liked Honey Salt, so I was excited to try this restaurant. Appearance of the decor is new and trendy. Was greeted with a smile and was shown to our seats. Started out with the dirty Mac n cheese. The dish was a perfect portion size with flavors that worked well with each ingredient. Ordered the pulled pork BBQ sandwich with the homemade potato chips. Wow, the flavors of this sandwich left an impression in my mind that this was the best BBQ pulled pork sandwich I have had in Vegas thus far. Tried a bit of the fish n chips dish and was o.k., but nothing I would personally ever order. A great experience that lived up to my own hype. Glad that another great restaurant is in the regular rotation list.

i kinda like honey salt so I was interested in experiencing the new venture.  I think i get what they are trying to do but the place has a severe identity crisis.  the menu isn't small but it feels like it. the beer menu flat out sucks.  another huge turn off is that the "happy hour menu" is only available at the bar or if you are sitting in "high chairs".  seriously? food wise, no surprise, it's pretty good.  we started with a jar of pimento cheese.  the taste was good but it was too creamy for me with no discernible visual evidence of pimentos.  the vegi accoutrements were pretty sad and a biscuit would have been a nice touch.  I had the hot dog for dinner.  it was really good but at $9.75 I would have expected more effort put into the fries that came with the dog.  they were pretty blah.  the donuts in a bag looked interesting for dessert but because I had applauded honey salt in my yelp review for resisting the 2005 rage, I passed on dessert.

I saw online that Made LV was having a Mardi Gras prix fixe dinner and I had to go.  The dinner was hosted by "Back of the House Brawl's" Jolene Maninna and Chef Canteenwalla.  I made a reservation for the start time at 6:30 and got there a few minutes before.  

The back of the restaurant was reserved for the dinner.  A server brought me an iced tea and suggested I might want to sit on the patio until they were ready.  I was joined by two women with whom I shared the rest of the evening and proved to be most excellent company.

In a short time, we were invited indoors and we took our seats at a four seat high top.  The food in order of presentation consisted of:  mini muffalettas, chicken gumbo, stuffed artichoke, jambalaya, and Cajun crawfish boil.  For dessert, we were served king cupcakes and hot beignets.  All the food was very good with two standouts, the gumbo and the jambalaya.  The broth of the gumbo was very rich and the jambalaya had a good amount of andouille, shrimp, and chicken.  I am not a crawfish person but it was OK for one night to mess with these little creatures and suck out the small amount of meat each one provides.  My feeling is that any crawfish should be served out of shell in an toufe.  

The king cupcakes did not have a baby baked in any of them out of fear that someone would swallow one while eating the cupcake too quickly.  At our table, we all used forks to eat the cupcakes just in case and then our server explained why there were none.  The beignets were delicious and served very warm.  Fresh was the word for sure!!

This was a fun two hours.  Served family style and getting a chance to eat with previous strangers, it was a marvelous Mardi Gras evening.  The stand out besides the food was the wonderful staff.  Our server was John.  He had a great personality, used our names when talking with us, and was on top of everything.  Other staff came by the replace serving plates or bring a basket with more mini muffalettas and everyone was in good form!

I hope Chef Canteenwalla continues special events like this.  The price was good, the food was great, and the entire evening was enjoyable and memorable.

Celebrating my anniversary as well as a friend's birthday.  Decided to give this place a try based on the other Yelp reviews.  We are really glad we did!

First of all, it's very warm and inviting.  There are board games to have fun with (Sorry, Connect4, Apples to Apples) as well as books to read through.  We chose Uno to kill some time. Everyone was super friendly!  

Gatsby was out waitress and she was excellent!  Our plates were never left in front of us and our glasses were always full. I had the fish & chips. YUM.  Hubby had a special Jucy Lucy burger which he raved about.  Their Philly was full and cheesy and their burgers flavorful. For dessert we had donut holes with berry jam. Yummy!

Definitely will be back :)

In the famous tone of Lil' John: "What...?". No, really, What?  I can't hear you from across the table.! Holy cow, I have been to UFC fights quieter than this place. 
Like Whitney Huston making sweet love to a jet engine, this place is shockingly loud.  

That aside, the food is astonishingly good. The burger is excellent, the humus is quite tasty, and the Mac n' Cheese is satisfying.  There are plenty of well cared about details present in the dishes.  Things like each fry having the proper amount of seasoning, the burger toppings are fresh and appealing, and the Mac n' Cheese being hot, but not like molten lava where you have to stare at it for a half hour before digging in.  

Aside from noise level which would even make Hellen Keller uncomfortable, the food is spot on. 

The service was good, with an attentive staff.  

Bring an appetite, but not a first date, unless of course they've already gotten on your nerves to the point that some downtime from talking would be welcome. 

S
Beer was flat and stale. Fish tacos were tough on the inside and soggy batter. Baja sauce was bad.  Only ate two bites and I'm worried I may get ILL.

My mother and I dined here for dinner on June 08. We sat in the dog patio area because I brought my yorkie with us. I love how they are dog friendly and very accommodating. John was our waiter and he was amazing. I eat out at least 5 times a week and I would say that this week he was the best service I had received, and yet it was our cheapest meal (only $46.75 before tip). The other gentleman that was helping him, I think was his busser, was also great and quick to check on us! It was dead inside, which was a bummer because I really want this restaurant to do well. The truffle found was so yummy and my burger was great too! Will be back soon!

If you find your self in Summerlin, near Tivoli Village. On any day of the week don't miss Made Lv, one of the 3 restaurants own by Elisabeth Blau and husband Kim. This is our first time for their famous Sunday brunch and I must say unbelievable the smoked beef Hash is to die for just full of flavor, the old fashioned toast sticks are not to be missed. Service is unbelievable..love sitting outside on one of their patios. The bar is happening great vibe. Can't wait to next Sunday.

This place is over-rated!! They were out of 4 of their menu items and the ribs were literally too attached to the bone to eat. The waitress was non-existent after we placed our order and had zero knowledge of the menu. Major disappointment. Do not recommend for food.

Located in Trivoli Village, it's a charming development perfect for date night or a dinner out with the family. Made LV has gotten a lot of publicity lately so we decided to try it out.  When we arrived we were told 15 minutes to get a table inside, 5 if we wanted outside, we picked wait 15 for inside. We told the hostess we'll grab a drink at the bar. Luckily, there was 2 seats together, we ordered a Bloody Mary for him which he found quite tasty and I had a vodka-club with muddled raspberries and a squeeze of lime, a simple concoction the bartender and I came up with since they didn't have any flavored vodkas. $17.00, normal for 2 cocktails. 15 minutes goes by, another 2 cocktails, $18.00, whaaaaaa? Okay.  30 more minutes goes by, where's our table? My husband asks the hostess about our table, she reassures him it's almost ready. 10 more minutes, I'm wasting away... Fortunately, I have muddled raspberries to chew on so I don't expire... Sitting and waiting an hour plus for our 15 minute table has given me to time to eye the decor which is very nice. Subway tiles line a counter and back wall area that has large chalkboards displaying different beers available. The tables are a dark wood with black metal chairs, a nice blend of farmhouse meets modern. What looks like reclaimed wooden planks line another large wall. The interior design and decor reminds me of something in Portland, Philadelphia or San Francisco, a nice change in scenery. 
Finally, the hostess comes over to us and says our outside table is ready. Huh? I say we'd requested inside. Oh. She wanders away in a half confused, half annoyed state. She returns 5 minutes later and gets us a table inside. Our waiter attends to us pretty quickly, a friendly guy. He gets us waters and asks with apps we'd like to try. Husband orders the buffalo butcher-style wings and also we place our dinner order. I get the BBQ chicken with steak fries substituted for mac n cheese, and Hubby gets the clams with red potatoes, corn on the cob and chicken chorizo in beer broth. The apps arrive with dinner, but I famished so I won't complain. The wings were okay, nothing spectacular, they seemed a bit wet and flavorless. Presentation on the metal plates was a nice touch though. BBQ chicken was pretty tasty, the sauce was delicious. Hubby ate all his plate, but said it wasn't as good as he'd hoped for.  We'd planned to get the s'mores nachos, but decided to walk around and get dessert somewhere else. All in all, ambiance was a hit, service (getting a table and apps separate from dinner) not so great (the waiter was a nice guy), price average ($63 for 2 people, minus cocktails). Not sure we'll return, looking forward to trying a couple other places getting a lot of talk right now.

I came in here on Sunday with my boyfriend.  It was our first time here.  We eat at Honeysalt a lot so I had high expectations.  Made is definitely a more casual vibe then Honeysalt.  There was a large bar, and I didn't realize there was outdoor seating since it was tucked away.  The hostess did not offer me a choice on outdoor seating which I was upset about after the fact, and didn't want to ask to be moved because my server seemed very sweet.  I think her name was Sienna or Sierra?  There was a lot on the menu that I wanted to try!  The waitress said she recommended the fig salad, so I did order one of those.  It was ripe figs in goat cheese, arugala, pistachios, pomegranate seeds and oil I think.  We also ordered the bacon and cheddar biscuits which were also fantastic and exactly what it sounds like.  The dirty mac and cheese was also good- it seemed to have peas and bacon inside with a gratin top.  I also ordered the shrimp and cilantro fritters.  These were like hushpuppies with maybe a small shrimp inside, corn, cilantro and a liquefied mousse-type dipping sauce that was all cilantro-flavoured.  I love cilantro so I did like the sauce.  The fritters were good but a bit greasy and not enough shrimp to my liking.  My boyfriend also ordered the eggplant Reuben, which is not something I would think I would like because I don't eat Reubens but love eggplant.  I ended up eating half his sandwich and loved it!  It was a very generous portion of sandwich and eggplant.  My last order was the doughnut hole bag.  I did like them, and the fruity sauce, but my boyfriend did not care for them.  They are comparable to the doughnut holes at Stack in the Mirage.  I would prefer chocolate sauce to Boysenberry but the Boysenberry was still good.  Food arrived very quickly and our total bill (not including gratuities) was just under $55.  That meal was a steal!  I will absolutely be back (but next time I will request outdoor seating.)

The decor is a little confusing, not sure the theme of the restaurant. We started with the ham and cheese plate it was well done. I has the fish fry for dinner, portion size was perfect. Prices are a little high.

Meh. Came in with a friend for dinner on a Monday night. The place had a nice casual ambience, with lots of seating. 

After perusing the menu with some interesting sounding items, I decided on the Fish Fry. I've been in a fish n chip kinda mood recently,  and the malt vinegar powder sounded right up my alley. I wasn't sure if I wanted to have something to drink with dinner, and the server brought me samples of 3 of his favorite beers, which was really cool of him. I even liked one of them enough to order it with my fish n chips!

Now,  when I asked about the portion of the meal I was told it was 3 pieces of cod, which sounded like a good deal for just about $20. When it came out, it was actually 5 pieces... of what looked to be 1 filet cut up to be bite sized.  So yeeeeeah, not that great. The malt vinegar powder wasn't what I was expecting either. The flavor was so subtle I practically emptied out the entire shake to get a good taste. The coleslaw was meh, the fries were meh (they have a lot of these, though). Not very busy in our section, but I overheard there might have been a large party in the back? Either way, after our order was brought to the table, we didn't really get checked on (maybe once?).

Overall, pretty standard, but what I had wasn't really worth the price. I am tempted to check out these doughnut holes, though.

Amazing brunch! Bottomless mimosas. Everything our group was in the mood for we could order. Delicious donuts, French toast, waffles and fried chicken, and breakfast tacos. Salt and Vinegar wings , salads, everything was DELICIOUS. We will be regulars. Sat on beautiful patio. Weather was terrific. This place rocks

Our waiter, John, was awesome! He definitely made our dining experience that much more enjoyable! And the brook trout was so delicious! The salt & vinegar chicken wings were also tasty. They weren't your average wings. They were a whole chicken wing. Will be back for sure!

Great food nice atmosphere and great service! 
The wife and i went here for lunch. First we got the dirty mac n cheese nice creamy cheesy goodness We also got the nachos verry tasty! Main corse i went with the burger it was cooked perfectly nice n juicy the bun it was on was really fresh and toasted just right, The wife tried the eggplant pastrami  samich she wasnt as impressed with this one nothing about it resembled pastrami, really more like a patty melt, But overall great  experience we will be back to try some more stuff
Amazing day. Went for a late lunch. Grab a stack of Uno cards and hung out on the patio. Perfect spring day. Food and service was very good. Waiter was funny and very interactive. Great time.

Made reservations for the latter part of lunch time and was greeted by Jeff, who was also our server. He was very VERY attentive but not intrusive. He was there when we needed him and allowed us time to hang out and catch up. We were there to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday and he made the experience wonderful. His attentiveness and thoughtfulness even made the paying for the check easy and uneventful, no fighting for the check!

We started with a couple of appetizers: Dirty Mac and Cheese and the hummus, both were awesome. The kids order burgers off their very creative book menus to keep the kiddos occupied and we ordered the half chicken and calms. Everyone walked away full and definitely planning on our next visit to MadeLV. Another incentive for me is that they have Steigl Grapefruit beer, one of my favorites.  We loved the Christmas ambiance, Jeff was amazing, and the food was great. American tavern with a twist, definitely a great addition to Tivoli.

Been twice now - once for dinner and once for lunch. Both times I felt service was a little off. Both times I sat on the patio, wonder if that is why? Not sure.

Moving on. For dinner I had their version of a bahn mi, which doesn't even appear to be on the menu anymore as of 2/20/15. Not sure if maybe it is a seasonal offering? I did enjoy the sandwich, although the bread was kind of tough. Came with fries in a cute little bag. One of Made LV's strong points is extra cute plating. 

The last time I dined here was for a lunch, myself and a co-worker took our manager out. It was a really nice day so we sat on the patio. Inside the red hat society was taking up a large portion of the restaurant and there were probably about 30 of them, so I think the place was over-loaded with their food order. Our food took about 45 minutes to arrive, and they forgot our biscuits as an appetizer. We even had to ask where our food was. Funnily enough as soon as we asked - it appeared within minutes. Not sure what was going on there. I think this lack of service, and lack of apology as to the food taking so long is definitely bringing down my rating.

Once the food arrived, it was delicious. I had the double-stack burger, comes with lettuce, tomato, red onions, and a pickle. It was cooked well, and it tasted good, but it isn't anything worth writing home about.

Overall Made LV is doing aaaall right. Not sure I will return. I've given it two shots and neither of those times has thoroughly impressed me.

We were on the search  for something new when we came upon Made LV Tavern in Tivoli Village. The menu is full of comfort food that will make you feel warm and fuzzy inside!

Bacon Cheddar Biscuits sounded like a great way to start the meal. They came with a honey butter salt dip. The biscuits were soft but I only had a bite because I know my husband loves biscuits so I let him have them.  They didn't last too long ! I had some salt and pepper kettle chips coming out so I didn't mind. My chips came with smoked onion dip. They were served warm and toasty and were delicious. 

I had the fried chicken entree with mashed potatoes and a side of collard greens.The chicken was really tender but I really wanted the chicken to be crunchier like Popeye's or KFC. It was well seasoned and it went well with the mashed potatoes. I'm not a big fan of collard greens but I had a little because I know they are good for you. 

I wanted to taste my husband's burger since I gave him the biscuits . The burger was super tasty even though he had his burger cooked very well done . ( I prefer medium rare) If you are looking for a good burger you should check this place out! 

We took the donut holes that came with caramel sauce to go. We needed to digest a little so after the short drive home we were ready for them. They were fluffy and lightly sugared. A perfect ending to a comforting meal!
They are OPEN, but I understand that they hanged their hours.  Also I heard they are moving to another location in a month or two.

Experience:  So good!!  Brought a friend for dinner to try this place out since I saw it had some great reviews. 

Facility:  very contemporary feel with high and low tables and chairs for seating. Also seemed to be a patio that it was too cold to enjoy. 

Service:  some good and bad points...our waiter was good, but once we said no to dessert, he immediately brought our check, although we were both drinking beer. Maybe they needed the table?! 
It was nice that the owner came by a few times for general chat. 

Food:  we decided to split several appetizers, so we could taste more things. 
Mac and cheese: had meat and peas in it, and a good cheese flavor.  I'm not a big pea fan, but they weren't overwhelming the flavor or anything. 
Fondue: was decent. Nothing to write home to mama about. 
Sweet potato fries: were great and sauce was amazingly addictive just like owner said!
Nachos: were good, but I had to pick off a bunch of onions that were not listed on the menu. 
Tenaya Creek was on tap and was good as usual. 

Overall:  I enjoyed the food, service, and atmosphere, so I would definitely come back (and will for sure when the figs are back in season!)
Go see Matty, great service his drinks are on point and who doesn't want to hear a Boston accent while drinking! Music is always great as is the food.. Killer happy hour to boot
Excellent! Came in for happy hour. And,food was fantastic. We ordered the nachos, burger and tacos. The biscuits were AMAZINg! Don't forget dessert! Doughnut holes! Yum!

I was surprised at how small this place is, it's more a bar than a restaurant.  I would come here again just for the banana pudding.  It's the bomb.  And maybe the bacon cheddar biscuits.  Otherwise the food was just okay overall.  They can handle a crowd really well though, and the drinks are stiff.
I have visited this restaurant twice.  I think the service and food is good, although somewhat expensive for the quantity you get.  I absolutely love their cheesy bisquits!

I recently attended one of Made's events- Mardi Gras party for 2015. I can not begin to tell you how much fun it was! We were led to the back entertainment area where the tables were dressed in newsprint NOLA style. The first course was the most a mini muffalata sandwich and a complimentary hurricane. They should put these beauties on the regular menu they were simply the best start. This was followed up by gumbo served in mini cast iron ramikins. I am a huge fan of gumbo and this was smooth tasty with a subtle kick. The chefs came out with live crayfish to tease all of us. Everyone loved the "floor show"! Fresh seafood in this town is always appreciated. The down home boil Traditionally potatoes cray fish and fresh corn medallions- KILLER! The knockout punch was the jambalaya. Better than anything I have eaten in NOLA- almost buttery! The sweet ending was handmade Beignets and mini king cakes. Chef Kim is going to run these events a couple of times
A month in various topics pairing food and spirits. They are priced well for the amount of food and drinks. I urge you to call and find out what is next on the calendar for Chef Kim and staff. If you have not come to MADE you are missing out!

Nice new restaurant in Tivoli. Excellent service, food, and atmosphere. The room is a bit noisy but bearable. 

We had crab cake, oysters, fish & chips, and smores nachos. All were very tasty and served very creatively. Service was very good. Some decent cocktails on the menu, decent wine list, and an okay draft beer list. Nothing special but decent. Worth a visit.

I got the Long Island ice tea and it was on tap. I was skeptical, but it was very good! We tried the bacon cheddar biscuits which were tasty. It was a fun, brightly lit bar. I will definitely need to return and try dinner.

Went for happy hour on Monday night to watch the football game. Everyone in our group left with extra drinks on their tab. This place will take advantage of large groups and charge you more than what you ordered. Portions are small and food less than stellar. Save yourself the time and money and go somewhere else in the complex. There are many better options with better service and more honest servers.

We've been here twice recently, and both times were treated with extremely friendly staff, incredible food, and fast service.  The grilled salmon is especially delicious, and bartender Matty even remembered us the 2nd time around.   I highly recommend this venue, and we'll definitely be back!

Enjoyed my meal (brunch) and the service was good.  I'd like to go back and try the happy hour menu. 

Only recommendation would be to have butter or jam for the grilled bread and season the food more.

Husband and I went here for date night. We were excited to come eat here after looking at the menu online. But sadly enough, we regret it. Service and the abeyance was good but the food was not all that great. Biscuits were cold in the middle and the batter on the fish fry was mushy. The funniest thing we saw was watching the managers or owners standing around like they were lost.

Food was amazing. Love that they have different card games and board games available for families while we are at the table. They need to make a lot more non pork options available. Otherwise the food was fantastic.

A little bit late coming but at least it made it.

Friends and I went to check out the place after hearing so many great things about it. I mean come on, an off shoot of Honey Salt, why wouldn't we?

Most restaurants won't sit until your whole party is present.  Well I didn't face that problem here.  Being the first one to show up for once the hostess was very pleasant and directed me to an open table while I waited for everyone to arrive.

The ambience was very relaxed. Lighting set the mood. Not too light, not too dark. Just the correct amount of lighting which set the start of a great night! However, on a Saturday night, it was very evident that the clientele was not toward the youngeryounger crowd. Which was fine by me! Only meant that we wouldn't be stuck waiting long for service, irate customers, etc.

When everyone arrived we started off with a few rounds of drinks. Nothing jumped out soecialty drink wise so we just ordered beers on tap, vodka drinks, Jameson shots and wine throughout the course of what turned out to be a 2 hour meal.

Bacon Cheddar Biscuits. Very clich  and all but everything tastes better with bacon! The biscuits were soft. Not hard. Very but try and just the right amount of bacon. Not over powering. And that's just the biscuits itself. Add the honey salt butter and my friend and I had to fight over who would get the last biscuit. We settled to have an extra order to go before we left because it was that good ( but after a couple hours of drinking we forgot! :-( )

"Bacon and Eggs" - It was deviled eggs set atop red onion jam and thick cut bacon accompanied with toast. One more dish that we had to fight over who was getting the last pieces. Bacon was so tender! Practically falls apart in your mouth. I am the type of person that views  deviled eggs as homey and should not be ordered at a restaurant unless there was a wow factor to it. And this makes me want to come back and have another go at it. The red onion jam had the right amount of sweetness to it that balanced out the mustardy flavor of the deviled eggs. I highly recommend it!

Smoked Ham Hock Nachos - I was not disappointed! The nachos came out crisp and not soggy. All the components complimented each other without ever being overpowering. 

American Ham and Cheese Board - Working in catering I get to sample better cheeses than what they offer but I was not disappointed with the selection and presentation. The cheese selections were Tillamook Cheddar, Laura Chenel Chevre and a buttermilk blue. All American cheeses from the west coast region. The hams were Three Little Pigs and Benton's Ham. What I was most drawn to was their mustard. I wish there was more of it on the board itself. Great accompaniment to the cheeses.

Chinese Chicken Salad - you would think it would be plain, even with the listed ingredients. But nope! Very refreshing salad. 1 order fed all four of us.

Roasted Bartlett Pear Salad - contained roasted pear and fresh honey crisp Apple slices. A very light and refreshing appetizer salad. Can't go wrong here. Roasted pears were done to perfection. Not over cooked. The fresh crisp apples added a nice contrast to the other ingredients. 

Bag of Doughnut Holes - we didn't have enough room after all the drinks and the food but we somehow managed to sneak in a dessert. The doughnut holes were light and fluffy. Not very heavy. A perfect ending to the meal if you want to keep it light (yes it's fried leave me alone). The salted caramel could stand to be a bit more saltier (hence the name) but I like my salt.

Staff - after all of the drinks we forgot the names of our server and runner. But they were very attentive. Quick to banter with your group and made the dining experience that much better. Nothing worse than a server that doesn't to be there. 

Overall - I would come back again after hearing there was an industry night! Can't wait to go back again. After all the food that we ate the check split four ways was around $40 - $50 / person. They hit the mark with their delivery of a modern take on comfort foods. Definitely recommend it to friends and looking to come back for more!

*Photos Posted*

So I have to post something about this even tho the restaurant is closing in 2 weeks. Me and my wife went to have dinner and drinks here last night. Love the fact that the food has a fun spin on things. We went and were seated by the manager and looked through the menu. We ended up ordering the Nashville hot chicken sandwich and split it. Before my wife took a bite she looked down at her chicken and noticed that the meat WAS RAW!!!!! Not a little bit cooked and pink in the middle. RAW!... We told our waiter/bartender about the situation and he apologized and removed the item off of our bill and discounted the rest at 30%... Now idk about you, but I took a couple bites out of my RAW chicken sandwich. Which could make me very sick... Don't you think the whole meal should have been comped??? But... Regardless me and my wife sat and decided to maybe try dessert... So we ordered and ordered another drink hoping it was just the chefs mistake...45 minutes later.... No dessert... So either the waiter didn't put our order in... Or the chef needs to be fired... So again.. Got our drinks comped off the bill... And left over $19 dollars... My wife has worked as a bartender and a server and so she struggles not to tip people in the service industry... Leaving the bartender a $10 dollar tip...which I honestly can't believe she did.. But we are working on her being too generous lol... Honestly this place is the worst.. And only go there if you are looking to get salmonella

Last night I was really excited to visit this location as I heard that two of my favorite people would be playing music in the patio. I thought it would be great to have something to munch on and a warm drink or two, sitting outdoors, next to the warm fire, listening to some great live music. I sat and listened to some great live music for the 2.5 hours I was there. As the band had taken their one break, the manager, very unprofessionally came out tapping his watch like a parent getting on their child because they've taken a break from their homework. What was even more embarrassing for the manager was that at the time he did this, no one was out on the patio at that time because it had just become too cold, in addition to no wait staff coming out to serve you a warm meal, snack or drink! Once management gets a grip on their wait staff, I would enjoy going back to hear my friends perform! Instead, I heard that management asked the performers not to come back. Hmmm, maybe the owner needs to get on their management for their lack of managerial skills and bad decision making. No need for me to back now.

I really enjoyed eating here. We had a lovely table on the lovely patio on a lovely Sunday morning. And our servers were friendly and attentive.

Unfortunately, I was universally disappointed by the food. It was all significantly less satisfying than I had expected it to be. To the point that I kept wondering if the problem was me. But I don't think it was. The food just missed the mark--almost as if it were trying too hard. In fact, 'way' and 'too' were the operative adjectives. Too rich (the signature biscuits). Way too sweet (the french toast sticks). Way way too fried (the home fries). Way way way too dense and dry (the banana pudding).

The pudding was particularly disappointing. I was looking forward to rich, smooth, creamy pudding, layered with whipped cream and wafers. I was served a poorly executed trifle. The home fries were similarly disappointing. They were unnecessarily deep-fried, to the point of being hard and crunchy.

I left Made LV feeling as if I had eaten an incredibly unhealthy meal, but not in the good way. Good, delicious, unhealthy food satisfies cravings that healthy food never can. This meal just made me wonder why I had eaten so much saturated fat without ever having to ask myself why unhealthy food tastes so good?

Went in at 2pm on a Saturday... The service was phenomenal!!! Please see my attached photos for the amazing food I ordered. We had a few things to try and everything was amazing!!! The place is decorated beautifully, and the prices are reasonable. The alcohol was a bit pricey but amazing selections and variety. I definitely will be back!

Food and service was excellent. I went here for brunch with my best friend. We were seated immediately and a server came over right away. Our server was amazing and very attentive. The reason I took a star away are the portions are really small. I ordered the deviled eggs which were delicious but it was one egg cut in half! The bread was delicious that came with it though. I also ordered the breakfast taquitos and they were tiny surrounded by a whole lot of black beans. I just wish there was more protein on the entree I was so hungry! The flavor was perfect but the portions nope! We had to leave and go eat a second brunch elsewhere because we were still so hungry. 

It was a really cool atmosphere and I think it would be better for happy hour or a drink then a small brunch.

I feel like this joint changes a lot in Tivoli village. And anytime I've been to one of the new places in this slot, I can see why. They're usually mediocre with okay service. 

And that is what we had last week. Horrible service at the bar with good food. 

We both had burgers. I had the Hang Over? It's newer on the menu. It had a fried egg, bacon, jam and cheese. The patty was overcooked, but the rest of the ingredients picked up the slack. 

We were there for over 2 hours and we kept having to get the bartenders attention to get something. There was a girl who sat next to us that he was very attentive to though...
And this place was dead for a Friday night. Which should show you, that's not a great sign. Most places in Vegas on a Friday night are PACKED. 

I feel "meh" about this place. I wasn't impressed for the price or the service.

First time at made, our food came out in a timely fashion and was hot.
We had the wagyu skirt steak- cooked perfect, stuffed artichoke was great no one does them like that, oysters super fresh. Service was good, our waiter was made some nice suggestions. The decor was fun, love the video games , music selection rocked! We will be back....

The birthday festivities continue!

Okay not so much this was my last spot. I wanted to try a new place with a friend who wanted to take me out for a late dinner. Honestly, I love how gourmet food looks but the presentation only goes so far for me. I skimmed through pictures my fellow yelpers posted and noticed some entrees were missing from the menu tonight. I believe, the menu was recently changed but everything we had was great comfort foods. 
Our server and the busser were very attentive to our table. It was a bit slow so I could respect the multiple check ups we had. When I go to new places I always ask what the server likes and tonight he recommended their hummus!!! It was delicious and I highly recommend it and a great portion. We had the deviled eggs as well. I was kinda disappointed in the size it was one egg cut in half with a thick slice of crispy bacon on the side. I didn't eat the bacon because I don't eat pork but for the sake of credit it was really thick slice and my friend enjoyed it!! I got a "spicy" chicken sandwich with a pesto sauce and shredded lettuce. It was good but nothing to rave about. I would come back to try that eggplant sandwich. We did get dessert and like must of you we got the donut bites! They were kind enough to write happy birthday on the tray. PS, we be-careful with the candle and paper bag. I blew my candle lightly into the bag and almost set it on fire. Lol

This place reminds me of Therapy (Downtown) and Public School (Downtown Summerlin) so if those places impressed your taste buds than this one will do so as well.

Love this place!  Prices are reasonable. Love the cold beer.  The manager Oscar came to our table and greeted us.  We had lots of fun!  Food is good too.  A bit more casual than the surrounding restaurants which is a good thing.

Well hello Made... welcome to the realz ;)
You were much anticipated to the 'hood. And while you have delivered sufficiently enough.. I personally believe you could be SOO much more. Consistency maybe your only flaw. 

Love your menu, love what you want to be...for those that only want to read the first few lines - yep, will definitely be back ;) As options for this area..you are doing everything right..very very right.

Love very much how Tivoli is evolving. (well, except for Brio, but .. no comment except for this about chains - they have their place) General appreciation for the valet...but parking is not problematic enough (yet) to need to valet. It is simply a 1% type of bs at the moment. 

New American type of menu, livers, crostini, fries in paper bags, craft cocktails...happy happy.. the menu reads and it delivers...we are not moving mountains here (yet).. but perhaps we have stood at the base looking up at the peak. looking to you Made LV...bring us to the promise land...we will happily follow.

When I go to Las Vegas, all I do is eat.  Luckily for me, my best friend is a local out there and she takes me to a ton of restaurants way off the Las Vegas Strip.  Made - LV is in a gorgeous, newly built shopping center quite a ways away from the strip.  It's a lovely restaurant, and the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.  That's a bonus!  

The dishes here are pretty small, which was great only because I got to try a bunch of different things.  We ordered the Bacon and Eggs, which consisted of one deviled egg (2 halves), some toast, and a really thick slice of yummy bacon.  Everything on the plate was good, it was just really small and hard to share between 5 people.  Next, we had the chicken liver, which also came with toast and pickles.  Most people don't like liver, but I LOVE it, so I had to try it.  It was well made, there were no harsh flavors, it was just creamy and perfect to spread on a nice piece of toast.  We also had the mac and cheese (nothing special), nachos (that was massive, but nothing special either), and bacon cheddar biscuits (ok, those were pretty good, and you could really taste the bacon baked in there).  I think that was all we ordered, since we were drinking beer.  They did have a nice selection of beers from local breweries.  I think that menu changes though, but I'd check it out.  

The food was decent, but I wasn't blown away by it.  I think the prices were a little on the high side, considering each of the dishes were pretty tiny.  It hasn't made my list of places to return to when I hit up Vegas again, but I won't say no if someone insists that they'd like to try it.  If I come again, maybe they'll change my mind.  A girl can wish.

Loved my experience here. My waiter "Jeff" gave us the best service, he really knew the menu and gave us excellent advices. The bacon cheddar biscuit is excellent, bbq pork ribs were tender and great. Everything we order is total recommended. Don't miss this place.
Captain Crunch French toast! I really enjoyed the brunch menu, decor, and service at this restaurant.

On Cinco de Mayo, Made LV American Tavern was the most attractive dining choice in Tivoli Village because my husband and I could get seated immediately. Cantina Laredo, on the other hand, had an astounding two hour wait! So much for having Mexican food on Cinco de Mayo, right? But, I digress...

EGGPLANT RUBEN ($10): Made LV's menu is quite small and there are even fewer options available for vegetarians. In all my years, however, I've never seen an eggplant ruben! The sauerkraut was barely detectable, as was the 1000 island dressing. The eggplant itself seemed to be void of any seasonings. The sandwich overall was just okay. I wouldn't get it again, but it was worth a shot. The meal came with a big bag of house chips, but I would've preferred fries!! 

SMOKEHOUSE BURGER ($12.50): Hubby promptly demolished this meaty burger and gave it the thumbs up. I helped myself to his bag of fries. :)

SERVICE: Made LV seriously fell short on service. Our server took about 5 minutes to greet us and take our orders. Then, he hardly checked up on us thereafter. My husband's coke was empty for days before it was refilled. The server didn't smile or attempt to feign friendliness, and I just felt like we were bothering him. 

AMBIANCE: Loved the industrial feel inside Made LV. I realized towards the end of my meal that there was a whole separate seating area behind the bar. Wish I would've sat there instead (since it's 21+)! There's an outdoor patio dining area as well. 

Worth a Return Visit?
My eggplant ruben wasn't particularity spectacular and the service was lackluster, but I'd be down to come back to Made LV to give them a second try.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #74

Items Selected:
Cheesy Garlic Toast -  Four cheeses
Bacon Cheddar Biscuits -  Honey salt butter
Country House Pate -  Pickles, fruit mostarda, grilled bread
Pimento Cheese -  Saltines, pretzel chips, breakfast radishes
Smokey Bleu Cheese Fondue -  Thick cut salt & pepper chips
Black Mission Figs -  Balsamic roasted & fresh, goat cheese, pistachios, pomegranate, arugula 
Baked Artichokes - Freekeh Stuffing, Parmesan, Lemon, Herbs, Garlic
Bacon & Eggs -  Thick cut bacon, deviled egg, red onion jam, grilled multigrain
Breakfast Poutine -  Two eggs, fries, turkey gravy, curds
Dirty Mac and Cheese -  Burnt pork ends, four cheese, peas, Ritz Cracker crust
Butcher Style Chicken Wings -  Hot smoked, flash fried, BBQ
Bag of Donut Holes -  Cinnamon sugar dusted
Banana Pudding -  Nilla wafers, whipped cream, salted caramel
Loaded S'Mores Nachos -  Graham crackers, torched marshmallows, toasted walnuts, Oreo cookie crumbs, chocolate sauce, fluff cream

The newest addition to Tivoli Village, MADE LV fills the seemingly cursed spot formerly inhabited by Bradley Ogden's Hops & Harvest and featuring the culinary talents of Kim Canteenwalla it was to a wide sampling of the restaurant's nouveau-American menu that I sat down with eight friends on Saturday afternoon, the results a resounding success as fourteen plates delivered in five courses arrived to nearly universal praise.  Offering a relaxed environment with touchtunes playing at a modest levels beneath a bistronomic tin-style ceiling as the Little League World Series showed on a pair of LCDs it was at a large banquette that our party was sat and with the open atrium bathed in sunlight our meal began quickly, the service spot-on throughout our two hour stay with several visits from the Chef himself assuring all was well.   Speaking next to the quality of the food it can only be said that while perhaps 'simple' by some standards the execution of nearly every dish of the afternoon was nothing short of exemplary and with much of our order trending towards the menu's heavier offerings it was perhaps unsurprising that flavors presented with aplomb, the cheddar biscuits a full-frontal savory assault finding levity in the creamy house blended butter while both the pimento cheese and rich fondue arrived in plethoric portions with extra chips and crackers offered compliments of the house.  Moving next to things more complicated the very few faults of the meal were found in early-season figs that had not yet found maximum sweetness and fries that trended slightly less crisp than savory toppings would afford but with deviled eggs set aside crisp bacon soon followed by reference standard mac n' cheese plus juicy wings rife with smoke beneath intensely crisp skin one would be hard pressed to complain - a trio of All-American sweets every bit on par with the savories finally rounding out a meal that more that lived up to the restaurant's promise of "good food, good drinks, and good company" from beginning to end.

I went to Made for the first time this weekend. Since I was alone, I sat at the bar. I ordered a Bangkok Mule, which was refreshing and tasty. I also got the chicken tacos, which were just the right size and a great blend of flavors. I'm a fan and will definitely be back. The prices are great for Vegas, too.

Good brunch, not the best bloody I've had but the price is right. Eggs Benedict was on point (on fleek as the kids say these days). Super friendly and attentive staff. All around a good time. Nice outdoor space. I'll definitely go back.

Best bar in Summerlin. Great bartenders, great beers, good food, excellent dcor.

Impossibly crowded Saturdays.
Don't miss the bacon cheddar biscuits!  Fish is always fresh and good. Bar/pub style ambiance is good. Parking either self or valet.

First time here. Friendly staff and knowledgeable bartender. Only came for a few quick bites and some coctails. My fiance and I each hand a handful of custom cocktails and they were delicious! We decided to enjoy the fish and chicken tacos and they were really flavorful.  Obviously, I can't speak for the other items, or why other people say that the food isn't  any good. What we had was great and we'll be returning to try more menu items in the future - as well as to hang with Matty at the bar! Only reason for not 5 stars is I haven't tasted other menu items. Will update in the future!

I'm not a drinker so I wanted to have just a couple of non-alcoholic beers.  $12...WOW...I didn't realize they had found the distributor that put gold in the bottle caps.  WTF?  Way out of line for that type of product.

I feel like my fiance is going to be upset with me when she sees that I've given Made 2 stars instead of one, but my burger was pretty good. Creekstone Farms patties, stacked two high, with a nice sharp cheddar on a soft brioche bun. The fries were served topped with sea salt and cracked black pepper. Pretty good burger and fries for $15.

But beyond that, our experience at Made showed evidence of a seriously mismanaged restaurant. We showed up for brunch and we order drinks. I order a Bloody Mary, and she orders the bottomless mimosas. Our waiter returns and tells me that they've run out of Bloody Mary mix, since it's made in-house and bla bla bla whatever. We showed up at 1pm, when brunch is supposed to last until 3 - you advertise bottomless Bloody Marys and you run out two hours before the end of the meal? Really? So my fiance and our friend order the bottomless mimosas, and after one round, our waiter returns and tells us that they've run out of champagne - and would they like to switch to Micheladas or mojitos or bla bla whatever. Again - you run out of an item advertised as bottomless? After selling it? And that certainly wasn't house-made champagne. This restaurant is 500 feet from a Total Wine store. How are you gonna run out of champagne at Sunday brunch?

Okay, now I'm angry enough again to take back that second star.

The third strike was when we asked for our check, and it sat under a credit card waiting to get picked back up for more than 20 minutes. There were maybe three other tables still eating in the whole restaurant, and our waiter literally walked right past without even looking in our direction more than once. My fiance's review of Made includes a photo of our waiter basically taking a nap in the front of house while our check sat there collecting dust. I'm inclined to be a little more charitable about it than she was. Obviously you have terrible managers. Obviously your restaurant is a terrible place to work. But don't take it out on us.

One star, only because Yelp won't let you give zero.

Brunch review only:

I can only assume that this place will end up out of business in 6 months time like every single restaurant that has ever occupied this particular space in Tivoli Village. This is probably the 5th restaurant that Ive noticed in the building and they simply never end up successful. 

The restaurant was empty, unsurprisingly, and the service a little slow given the circumstances. But ultimately, the food was pretty good- definitely above average and that's enough to at least consider going back if Im in Tivoli in the future.

-Bacon Cheddar Biscuits. What is there to say really. They are bacony and cheddary and biscuity. Obviously very tasty. Biscuit was flakey on the outside and melty on the inside.

-Corned Beef hash. Pretty good. Nothing fancy or creative certainly although the presentation was definitely above average. Seasoned well. Solid dish.

-Breakfast Tacos. Chorizo avocado eggs queso fresco and more. Not bad by any means. I could probably make this myself with relative ease though.

-Donut Holes. Only average. Jam not blowing anyone away. Donuts freshly baked and warm though.

At the end of the day this place is probably a 3.5. What I ate was good but it didnt quite feel like something I needed to get at a restaurant and couldnt make at home. Now will I make this food at home? Certainly not, Im not a pleb. But I could. Compared to many other brunch locations in Vegas it has some work to do but the food tasted above average which is enough for me to feel satisfied.

Places like these kill me; so much potential yet quality of food and pricing is horrible! If you are looking for a place to dine with no reservations and small portions with over priced items, this is your place!
We came here on a Sunday at 11am and was shocked to see that we were the only ones there. Sunday Brunch has been the new trend so seeing no one was an instant red flag. 
Basically to sum up the experience, the server was experienced enough to make a decision on my nephews blue berry pancakes that were ordered to take the blue berries out because he would like it better, your breakfast 'entree' is really an appetizer, toast-well lets just say they throw it on a grill to warm it for you but basically you get warm soft bread with no jam or butter. The breakfast tacos, 3 to a plate which consisted of 3 bites with that horrible green color 'fake' guacamole on it yet the description clearly said avocado. The frittata is really just a flat greasy omelet. I had to google it to make sure I knew what a frittata was; doesn't even compare. 
Looks are definitely deceiving. I'll do you a favor and tell you to cross it off your 'places to try' now.

Seven Yelpers and two Yelpers-in-training, AKA small children with good taste, arrived at 11:30am on the Saturday after Made LV opened its doors for business. Basically the first ones there, the empty restaurant eventually filled up as we made our way through much of the menu together.  Because we shared, it was a good way to taste a bit of each dish.

We had:  Cheesy Garlic Toast, Bacon Cheddar Biscuits, Pimento Cheese, Smokey Bleu Cheese Fondue, Black Mission Figs, Bacon & Eggs, Baked Artichokes, Breakfast Poutine, Dirty Mac N Cheese, Chopped Chicken Liver, Butcher Style Chicken Wings,  and all three of the desserts, Bag of Donut Holes, Banana Pudding, and the Loaded S'mores Nachos.  14 dishes, with 2 orders of each one, came to $231 and change.

Highlights for me:
I loved the biscuits--the honey salt butter accompanying them is wonderful.  I must get my own order next time because I only had a small piece since we were sharing.
I am also a fan of the pimento cheese, something I haven't had since I was a little girl in the Dark Ages.  This is a generous serving, literally a jar of pimento, so when you run out of crackers and pretzel chips, just ask the friendly servers for more.   I ate a lot of this! 
The mac n cheese with burnt pork ends is a good version that I'd have again, as well as the figs with goat cheese, pistachio, and pomegranate seeds.  Of the three desserts, I liked the donuts the best, but that's only because I'm not a big fan of the other two desserts offered, in general.  And, the donuts are served up warm with cinnamon sugar, my favorite; I'd love them even more with chocolate sauce instead of the berry one that they came with!
Service was excellent from start to finish and Chef Kim Canteenwalla made it a point to visit our table more than once, as well as the other diners in the restaurant.

Open Wed-Sun, 11:30am - 11:00pm
Monday and Tuesday, 4:00pm-11:00pm
Happy Hour,  4:00pm-6:00pm, Monday through Friday.
Welcome to Tivoli Village, MadeLV; I think you'll be making more fans along the way.

The food was delicious and menu was very creative. Service was great. But it's SOOOO NOISY.  There's not a thing inside the restaurant to absorb any noise. Very loud and in my opinion, the wrong music choice altogether for dinner.

Gr8 food pulls this place to a 5.  Service is good.  Ambience is nice.  Superior bar.   I like the prime rib, chicken salad, eggplant Reuben, appetizers, desserts and specials,   Not cheap but in Tivoli Village.  Happy hour deals.  Same quality as Honey Salt.

3.5 stars...but the system won't allow for the half star.

It is a nice space...our server was friendly and very attentive. 

The food was average to better than average, but nothing that wowed us..

We had the figs which were tasty....split a hamburger which didn't seem to be consistent with the name..it wasn't massive..the fries were skinny fries and I prefer steak fries..

For dessert we had the donut holes...the dipping sauce was very good...without it the donut holes were just average.

We will come back and try other things..watch some sports and such.

The food is upscale,  inventive,  bar food. The BBQ pork sandwich was good. The BBQ sauce is vinager based and the pork is roasted on site. The sweet potatoe fries were good but average. Teya, my server, was very knowledgeable on the food prep as well as the many draft offerings. Hopefully this place makes it in this restaurant black hole location.

Came here for Brunch and had a GREAT time.  I've been here before throughout the week nights and I must say this place has stayed consistent with their fantastic, attentive service (and YUMMY food).  We love coming here, and recently tried the brunch menu- so yummy, great prices and sitting on the patio was fun! Definitely coming back here and very happy with this restaurant!

Another place I wanted to check out. Rolled in about 1245pm on a Saturday afternoon, place was fairly empty. Maybe 20 tables or spots at the bar filled. I sat down at the bar and was quickly greeted by Dave the bartender. Dave was really nice, provided great service and makes a strong Bloody Mary. 
I went with the Dirty Mac and Cheese plus bacon cheddar biscuits. My heart is not happy with me but my stomach was. Both were very tasty. $7 for the Dirty Mac is a good price for a decent portion that filled me up. Bloody Mary was $8 which seems a bit steep, but then again its Tivoli Square where nothing is cheap.
I was looking for a decent place to watch games. This didn't fulfill the bill as they only have a few TV's and it can be noisy.Definitely they focus on food.
I might stop by again and try a bbq pork pulled sandwich. No real breakfast foods as they open at 1130am.

I'm no food snob, but I do enjoy dining experiences.  

After a night in Tivoli Village, we decided on this restaurant.  Yelp listed it as "Hot and New".  We definitely wanted to see what was good about this place.  

We ordered a bunch of dishes, to share, and we left wanting a little more.  Not in terms of being full, but in terms of being blown away by what we ate.  

 THE POSITIVES:
-Great drink selection!
-The dirty mac and cheese was wonderful.
-The nachos were delicious.
-The service and wait staff were attentive, cool and the manager delivered a re-fire on our clams.  

THE NEGATIVES:
- I ordered the steamed clams and the first order was way too salty.  The salty broth overpowered everything.  I also had a lot of grit between my teeth from those clams.  I'm not sure if they washed the clams, but it was a lot of sand.  I asked the waitress if she could get me a new order and she did.  The manager brought us the new dish and, yes, it was less salty, but the grit was still there.  At that point, I didn't feel like waiting and I didn't want to seem like that a**hole that is never satisfied.  It's a shame because i really wanted to enjoy that dish.

THE OKAYS:
-The artichoke was okay.
-The smoked onion dip was okay.
-The BBQ chicken wings were not great.
-The cheese fondue was okay.  I didn't mind the truffle oil, but my friend wasn't too crazy about it.  

OVERALL:
I should've gotten a burger or something more of a main course.  I can't say that this restaurant will be on my rotation of "go to" places to dine, but I'll probably give it another chance sometime down the road.

Celebrated my birthday here last night for late night happy hour with a group of friends. Their happy hour menu is great, but I think their regular menu is reasonable also. The bartender was amazing!! He split our checks easily (which can always be a pain some places), he was really attentive, took multiple pictures for us, and was just all around awesome! We had a really great time and will definitely be back for happy hour again!

I've also come here a few times for brunch and the food is always great! Of course, bottomless mimosa's is a plus as well. Definitely one of my favorite spots to go.

Our first visit here.   Cool fun vibe...smaller than I expected though.  Service was attentive and friendly.

We shared the roasted figs with goat cheese.  I could eat that all day.  Nom nom nom!

Next we shared the double burger.  Very tasty and juicy meat.  We opted to leave it just the meat and cheese. It didn't need anything else.   Great bun too! 

Topped off the meal with the homemade donuts. The fresh berry dipping sauce made the dessert.  Raspberry BlackBerry reduced in fresh squeezed orange juice.  Very nice!

We'll be back!

First, the special was not described to me correctly. It was covered in onions and peppers, which was not mentioned by the waitress. The could not remake without onions and peppers, so I asked for the BBQ Pulled Pork. It was plain...it tasted like pan fried pork on a bun.

It was also expensive. $65 for 3 people for lunch, and they didn't give us a break for the special not being described correctly. Too bad, I wanted to like this place.

Fall weather calls for fabulous patio work lunches.

We arrived before the lunch rush and were seated out on the patio. They have a lot of great options, so we decided to share a number of items and we couldn't resist dessert.

We had the baked artichoke, mussels, corn and shrimp fritters, extra garlic bread to sop up all the rest of the juice from the mussels and we topped off our delicious lunch with freshly made doughnuts with raspberry dipping sauce.

Everything was great and I look forward to coming back to try the rest of their menu. I highly recommend the mussels and baked artichoke. Service was great and refills were plentiful. 

I haven't been to Tivoli very often, but with places like Made LV, I'm willing to explore Tovoli a little more often.
